vague_description: Balancing resource allocation to minimize costs and waste while ensuring optimal workforce effectiveness.
detailed_description: The company’s declared objective is to minimize redundancy. Requirement are given as \param{K} different resources each having \param{I} specific requirements, where \param{Strength} is the strength of each type of resource, \param{LessOneWaste} is the value when wastage of resources is less than optimal, \param{MoreOneWaste} is the value when wastage of resources is more than optimal. \param{Recruit} is the number of recruited resources of each type, \param{CostRedundancy} is the cost of redundancy for each type of resource, \param{NumOverman} signifies the number of overmanned positions, \param{CostOverman} is the cost of overmanning for each type of resource, and \param{NumShortwork} represents the number of shortworked positions with \param{CostShort} as the cost of short working for each type of resource. How should they operate in order to do this?
target_objective: Minimize the total cost of redundancy, overmanning, and short working for the company
target_constraints: Recruit, NumOverman, and NumShortwork must be non-negative for each type of resource
Amount of each resource used must be at least equal to I - LessOneWaste if there is less wastage
Amount of each resource used must not exceed I + MoreOneWaste if there is more wastage
target_parameters: Total number of different types of resources
Number of different requirements for each type of resource
Strength of each type of resource
Value when wastage of resources is less than optimal
Value when wastage of resources is more than optimal
Number of recruited resources of each type
Cost of redundancy for each type of resource
Cost of overmanning for each type of resource
Cost of short working for each type of resource
